comment.body: hiho, how can I be sure that no one has manipuleted or is sending the wrong database/sql?

> [nofish](#comment_147_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): The database file is never got synced, but it's generated from .json files that are always signed by the owners.

thx and how can I trust that every user is sharing all the users/json-files? e.g. if all my 21 of 21 connections are all refusing to publish abc-users json-file, would I notice that?
what about zeromail? how does it differ from real bitmessage?

> [nofish](#comment_168_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Works similarly, but it's more like a demo of the possibilities of the network, since it's just a normal ZeroNet site that anyone can create.

but is it as secure as bitmessage against nsa?
